.. _`bio/mixcr/exportAlignments`:

MIXCR EXPORT ALIGNMENT
======================

export alignment results from a binary file (.vdjca) to a human-readable text file with `mixcr <https://mixcr.readthedocs.io/en/master/export.html#export>`_

**URL**: 

Example
-------

This wrapper can be used in the following way:

.. code-block:: python

    rule test_mixcr_export_alignments:
        input:
            "alignment.vdjca"
        output:
            "export.txt"
        wrapper:
            "0.50.4-2418-g8fefa1e53/bio/mixcr/exportAlignments"

Note that input, output and log file paths can be chosen freely.

When running with

.. code-block:: bash

    snakemake --use-conda

the software dependencies will be automatically deployed into an isolated environment before execution.

Software dependencies
---------------------

* ``mixcr==3.0.3``

Input/Output
------------
**Input:**

* Alignments in vdjca format

**Output:**

* TSV-formetted text file





Authors
-------

* Thibault Dayris


Code
----

.. code-block:: python

    #!/usr/bin/python3
    # -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

    """This is the Snakemake Wrapper for mixcr export aligments"""

    __author__ = "Thibault Dayris"
    __copyright__ = "Copyright 2020, Thibault Dayris"
    __email__ = "thibault.dayris@gustaveroussy.fr"
    __license__ = "MIT"

    from snakemake.shell import shell

    log = snakemake.log_fmt_shell(stdout=True, stderr=True)
    extra = snakemake.params.get("extra", "")

    shell(
        "mixcr exportAlignments {extra} {snakemake.input} {snakemake.output} {log}"
    )
